page.title: 13Trade
page.content: {Trade} Both Netherton and Flockton suffer a lack of shops compared to their recent past. This is because of the growth of supermarkets in other areas, together with the ease of transport via private cars to larger centres of trade i.e. Wakefield, Huddesfield, Barnsley and Leeds. Small shops cannot make a reasonable living for their owners as they are generally only used as stop-gaps for forgotten items, and therefore there has been a marked decline in grocery type stores. Each village has a Post Office which also sells some food items together with newspapers, cigarettes, sweets etc. But there are literally only one or two other shops in either village. Netherton has recently aquired a one stall open market type amenity which is a green grocery stall 3 days a week
